title: GAdaBoost: An Efficient and Robust AdaBoost Algorithm Based on Granular-Ball Structure
content:
PublicationKnowledge-Based Systems, 2025
AbstarctAdaptive Boosting (AdaBoost) faces significant challenges posed by label noise, especially in multiclass classification tasks. Inspired by granular computing, this paper proposes granular adaptive boosting (GAdaBoost), a novel two-stage framework comprising a data granulation stage and an adaptive boosting stage, to enhance efficiency and robustness under noisy conditions. Experimental results demonstrate that the proposed approach achieves superior robustness and efficiency compared with existing methods.

title: GBG++: A Fast and Stable Granular Ball Generation Method for Classification
content:
PublicationIEEE Transactions on Emerging Topics in Computational Intelligence, 2024
AbstarctGranular ball computing (GBC) is an efficient, robust, and scalable learning method that has become a popular research topic of granular computing. This paper proposes GBG++, a fast and stable granular ball generation method based on the attention mechanism. The proposed method only needs to calculate distances from the data-driven center to undivided samples when splitting each granular ball, significantly improving both stability and efficiency compared to existing GBG methods.

title: Approximate Borderline Sampling using Granular-Ball for Classification Tasks
content:
PublicationIEEE International Conference on Data Engineering (ICDE) 2025
AbstarctThis paper proposes an approximate borderline sampling method using granular-balls for classification tasks. First, a restricted diffusion-based GB generation (RD-GBG) method is proposed to prevent GB overlaps through constrained expansion. Second, based on the concept of heterogeneous nearest neighbors, a GB-based approximate borderline sampling (GBABS) method is proposed, which is the first general sampling method capable of both borderline sampling and improving the quality of class noise datasets.
